generated.title: GeneratedSpecificHeatCapacity
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'SpecificHeatCapacity'

description*.en: Specific Heat Capacity of a solid or liquid is defined as the heat required to raise unit mass of substance by one degree of temperature. This is Heat Capacity divided by Mass. Note that there are corresponding molar quantities.

title: SpecificHeatCapacity
description: Specific Heat Capacity of a solid or liquid is defined as the heat required to raise unit mass of substance by one degree of temperature. This is Heat Capacity divided by Mass. Note that there are corresponding molar quantities.
